procedureCodes.description: Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical; ethmoidectomy, total (anterior and posterior), including maxillary antrostomy, sphenoidotomy, and/or frontal sinus exploration (when performed); bilateral

evidence.description: Primary FESS procedure covering multiple sinus surgeries.
evidence.excerpt:
Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery (FESS), including:

   b. Right maxillary antrostomy
   c. Left frontal sinusotomy
   d. Bilateral nasal polypectomy
Placement of absorbable nasal packing (MeroGel, 2 units, 1 per side)

evidence.description: Specific procedure for bilateral nasal polypectomy.

evidence.excerpt: Chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps, bilateral (ICD-10 J32.4, J33.0)
Chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps, bilateral (ICD-10 J32.4, J33.0)

modifierSuggestions.rationale: The procedure involved bilateral total ethmoidectomy and bilateral nasal polypectomy.
modifierSuggestions.fullJustification: The operative note explicitly states 'Bilateral total ethmoidectomy' and 'Bilateral nasal polypectomy', indicating the procedure was performed on both sides.

modifierSuggestions.rationale: A resident (Dr. Kim) participated under direct supervision for the entirety of the procedure.
modifierSuggestions.fullJustification: The note states 'Dr. Kim (resident) participated under direct supervision for the entirety of the procedure, including all critical steps.', supporting the involvement of two surgeons.

evidence.excerpt: Dr. Kim (resident) participated under direct supervision for the entirety of the procedure, including all critical steps.

modifierSuggestions.rationale: To indicate that the polypectomy was a distinct procedure from the FESS, if not bundled.
modifierSuggestions.fullJustification: While polypectomy can be part of FESS, if billed separately, modifier 59 would indicate it was a distinct service.

sequencingRationale: Primary procedure first, then other significant procedures, then minor procedures.

caseNotes.primaryNoteText:
OPERATIVE NOTE

Patient Name: Emily Johnson     MRN: 246801     DOB: 11/08/1973
Date of Surgery: 05/20/2025    Time: 09:12 AM
Surgeon: Dr. Amir Patel     Assistant: Dr. Jennifer Kim (PGY-3 Resident)
Anesthesia: General Endotracheal

Pre-op Diagnosis: Chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps, bilateral (ICD-10 J32.4, J33.0)
Post-op Diagnosis: Same

Procedures Performed:
1. Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery (FESS), including:
   a. Bilateral total ethmoidectomy
   b. Right maxillary antrostomy
   c. Left frontal sinusotomy
   d. Bilateral nasal polypectomy
2. Placement of absorbable nasal packing (MeroGel, 2 units, 1 per side)
3. Application of Surgicel (oxidized regenerated cellulose, 3 strips for hemostasis)

Indication: Refractory symptoms of sinusitis and nasal obstruction, unresponsive to maximal medical therapy.

Findings: Diffuse polyposis, edematous mucosa, purulent drainage, polypoid tissue obstructing all sinuses involved.

Description of Procedure:
After induction, the patient was prepped and draped in usual sterile fashion. Using a 0-degree endoscope, the nasal cavity was evaluated. Polypoid tissue was removed from bilateral nasal passages. Total ethmoidectomy performed bilaterally with careful dissection. Right maxillary antrostomy and left frontal sinusotomy completed. Hemostasis achieved with Surgicel (3 strips total). MeroGel absorbable packing placed, one unit per nostril. All tissue sent to pathology. Dr. Kim (resident) participated under direct supervision for the entirety of the procedure, including all critical steps. No intraoperative complications.

Disposition: Patient to PACU in stable condition.

Attestation: Resident (Dr. Kim) involved throughout; attending present for all key portions and final closure.
